intro: Oldenlandia villosostipulata, commonly known as the hairy-stipule oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite, with hairy undersides and distinctive stipules. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
